The terrorists will not leave just bc US forces do...and still fully intend to attack the West...as we saw under #ISIS and Pres Obama.

We have had 50k troops in Japan 30k in Korea 30-100k in Germany 70+ yrs since WWII. If the concern is bringing soldiers home cost or length of mission reductions in those countries are far less dangerous to US security

Plus #ISIS is resurgent held back only by constant strikes by US/Afghan forces. We must 1. maintain pressure on the terrorist groups 2. continue to advise the Afghan Army until they can fully stand on their own. We are not nation-building/policing.

Intelligence community military and counterterror analysts show that the Taliban still have a symbiotic relationship with al Qaeda and captured documents show AQ’s leaders plan to reconstitute in the wake of an American withdrawal....

Frustration among veterans w #Afghanistan is understandable.  Missing from the Vets panel discussion w @marthamaccallum is that Al Qaeda is NOT destroyed ISIS is on the rise and both will plan attacks on America again in the chaos of an American withdrawal.
